{"id":1521556421,"question_id":3712,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"1 week, 4 days","timestamp":1737933449,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"104 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1521556421/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Minimum Cost to Make Arrays Identical","memory":"189.3 MB","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    long long minCost(vector<int>& arr, vector<int>& brr, long long k) {\n        int n = arr.size();\n        long long res1=0;\n        long long res2=0;\n        for(int i=0; i<n; i++)\n            res1 += abs(arr[i]-brr[i]);\n        sort(arr.begin(), arr.end());\n        sort(brr.begin(), brr.end());\n        for(int i=0; i<n; i++)\n            res2 += abs(arr[i]-brr[i]);\n        return min(res1, res2+k);        \n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"minimum-cost-to-make-arrays-identical","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
